posts.title: Petrol, diesel prices today: Rates constant on 29 November, check here what you need to pay in your city
posts.desc: Petrol and diesel prices on 29 November 2021: Petrol price in Delhi stands at Rs 103.97 per litre while diesel is available for Rs 86.67. In Mumbai, petrol is retailing at Rs 109.98 while diesel costs Rs 94.14

posts.title: 'Why no arrests like Aryan Khan?': CAIT demands action against Amazon officials in MP drug bust case
posts.desc: This isn't the first time CAIT, which has been demanding a codified law for e-commerce since 2017, has taken aim at Amazon

posts.title: Reliance Jio prepaid plans to be hiked by up to 20% from 1 Dec, check details here
posts.desc: These plans will provide the best value in the industry. Upholding the Jio promise of providing the best-quality service at the lowest price globally, Jio customers will continue to be the biggest beneficiaries, Jio said

posts.title: Paytm Q2 result: Loss widens to Rs 473 crore on account of hiked payment processing charges
posts.desc: Its consolidated total income increased by 49.6 percent to Rs 1,086.4 crore during the reported quarter from Rs 663.9 crore in the corresponding period of FY'21.

posts.desc: In Mumbai and New Delhi, the selling price of 10 grams of 22-carat gold touched Rs 46,950 and Rs 47,010, respectively

posts.title: Market Roundup: Sensex plunges 1687 points, Nifty ends at 17,026; check top winners and losers here
posts.desc: In terms of sectoral indices, auto, media and metal incurred losses of over 3 percent, while pharma rose by 1.70 percent. India VIX rose by 24.84 percent to jump to 20.80 levels. BSE Midcap fell by 3.23 percent to 24,846.51 while BSE Smallcap  declined by 2.61 percent  to 24,846.51

posts.title: Market update: Sensex crashes over 1,200 points, Nifty dips below 17,200-mark
posts.desc: The domestic market indices BSE Sensex and NSE Nifty were in freefall on the morning of Friday, 26 November

posts.title: Strong demand, rising vaccination rate drive positive outlook for Indian corporates: Moody's
posts.desc: In a report, the rating agency said credit fundamentals are favourable for India's companies on a sustained economic recovery and earnings of rated companies' will rise on strong consumer demand and high commodity prices

posts.title: Cryptocurrency won't be legal tender by any means, says finance secretary TV Somanathan
posts.desc: Somanathan's remarks come amid the backdrop of the Centre's decision to bring a bill in the Winter Session of Parliament to regulate cryptocurrency and a crash in prices of some popular cryptocurrencies

posts.desc: Under sectoral indices, auto registered losses while metal, realty, media and IT were in green

posts.desc: The Rs 1,013.6 crore Initial Public Offering IPO of the company was subscribed 135 times.

posts.title: WazirX restored, huge panic selling led cryptocurrency exchange app's crash, says CEO Nischal Shetty

posts.title: Rupee slips 12 paise to 74.54 against US dollar in early trade

posts.title: 'Not a ban': Centre regulating cryptocurrency to check role in 'hawala', terror funding, say sources
posts.desc: As markets and experts speculate on the consequences of Centreâ€™s move to bring a bill to regulate cryptocurrency, sources in the security establishment told CNN-News18 that the regulation will not be an outright ban
